subject: Baseball
Athletics and Sports
lead_paragraph: Leo Mazzone was fired as the pitching coach of the Baltimore Orioles, less than two weeks after completing his second season with a struggling staff. Mazzone worked wonders with the Atlanta Braves from 1990 through 2005, but could not duplicate that success with the Orioles. Baltimore ranked 29th among 30 teams with a 5.17 earned run average and yielded more walks (696) than any major league club.
